Docs.summary: Specifies the resource consumed by the member of a class. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the ResourceConsumptionAttribute attribute is applied to a member, the <xref:System.Runtime.Versioning.ResourceExposureAttribute> attribute must also be applied.
If the resource scope of the consumed resource is different than the resource scope of how it is consumed, the constructor that takes a `consumptionScope` parameter should be used to specify how the resource is consumed. For example, a resource may be exposed as a <xref:System.Runtime.Versioning.ResourceScope> resource, but only used at the <xref:System.Runtime.Versioning.ResourceScope> and <xref:System.Runtime.Versioning.ResourceScope> scope. For this example the `consumptionScope` parameter is set to <xref:System.Runtime.Versioning.ResourceScope> | <xref:System.Runtime.Versioning.ResourceScope>.
The `resourceScope` parameter in the constructor must specify a <xref:System.Runtime.Versioning.ResourceScope> greater than or equal to the resource exposure of all called members. For example, a method consuming two <xref:System.Runtime.Versioning.ResourceScope> resources and one <xref:System.Runtime.Versioning.ResourceScope> resource would be identified as consuming a <xref:System.Runtime.Versioning.ResourceScope> and a <xref:System.Runtime.Versioning.ResourceScope> resource by setting `resourceScope` to <xref:System.Runtime.Versioning.ResourceScope> | <xref:System.Runtime.Versioning.ResourceScope>.
`Public` members cannot expose <xref:System.Runtime.Versioning.ResourceScope> or <xref:System.Runtime.Versioning.ResourceScope> resources. <xref:System.Runtime.Versioning.ResourceScope> members cannot expose <xref:System.Runtime.Versioning.ResourceScope> resources.
The graph of methods terminates when a <xref:System.Runtime.Versioning.ResourceExposureAttribute> attribute with a resource scope of <xref:System.Runtime.Versioning.ResourceScope> is applied to a method.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the <xref:System.Runtime.Versioning.ResourceExposureAttribute> attribute specifies a scope of <xref:System.Runtime.Versioning.ResourceScope>, then the <xref:System.Runtime.Versioning.ResourceConsumptionAttribute> attribute must specify a resource it consumes and how it consumes it, by specifying a value for the `consumptionScope` parameter.
The scope specified by `consumptionScope` should be less than or equal to the scope specified by `resourceScope`. For example, a <xref:System.Runtime.Versioning.ResourceScope> scope can be consumed as a <xref:System.Runtime.Versioning.ResourceScope> or <xref:System.Runtime.Versioning.ResourceScope> scope, but not as a <xref:System.Runtime.Versioning.ResourceScope> scope.
